title: Hyundai Creta EX(O) with panoramic sunroof launched at Rs 12.97 lakh
description: The Hyundai Creta range has been updated for 2025 with two new variants – SX Premium and EX(O). Hyundai will also offer new features and colour options for some existing variants of the Creta, albeit with a price hike for most of the top-spec SX(O) trims. Hyundai Creta EX(O) variant most affordable variant with panoramic sunroof SX Premium trim offers ventilated front seats, Bose sound system and powered driver's seat All SX(O) variants, except the diesel auto, receive price hike of Rs 8,000 Hyundai Creta EX(O) variant Most affordable Creta variant to get panoramic sunroof Joining the lower rungs of the Creta line-up, the EX(O) trim offers a panoramic sunroof and LED reading lamps as standard. The variant starts at Rs 12.97 lakh and can be had with both the 1.5-litre turbo-diesel and 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine options, mated to either a 6-speed manual or a CVT transmission. Starting at Rs 16.18 lakh, the SX Premium variant can be had with either the 6-speed manual or CVT for the Creta’s 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol unit, but only the manual option for the 1.5-litre turbo-diesel engine. Hyundai Creta SX Premium price breakdown (ex-showroom)VariantPrice (Rs, lakh)1.5P 6MT16.181.5P CVT17.681.5D 6MT17.76 Hyundai Creta SX(O) price and features increased Only SX(O) diesel automatic exempt from price hike Most of the Creta’s SX(O) variants have undergone a price increase of Rs 8,000 as part of the 2025 model refresh, and it now starts at Rs 17.46 lakh. Curiously, Hyundai hasn’t hiked prices for the SX(O) diesel automatic trim, which still costs Rs 19.99 lakh. Buyers can also choose two new colour options – Titan Grey Matte and Starry Night – on all Creta variants. html:
The newly added EX(O) variant is the most affordable Hyundai Creta trim to offer a panoramic sunroof.

The Hyundai Creta range has been updated for 2025 with two new variants – SX Premium and EX(O). Hyundai will also offer new features and colour options for some existing variants of the Creta, albeit with a price hike for most of the top-spec SX(O) trims.

  1. Hyundai Creta EX(O) variant most affordable variant with panoramic sunroof
  2. SX Premium trim offers ventilated front seats, Bose sound system and powered driver's seat
  3. All SX(O) variants, except the diesel auto, receive price hike of Rs 8,000

Hyundai Creta EX(O) variant

Most affordable Creta variant to get panoramic sunroof

Joining the lower rungs of the Creta line-up, the EX(O) trim offers a panoramic sunroof and LED reading lamps as standard. The variant starts at Rs 12.97 lakh and can be had with both the 1.5-litre turbo-diesel and 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine options, mated to either a 6-speed manual or a CVT transmission.

Hyundai Creta EX(O) price breakdown (ex-showroom)
VariantPrice (Rs, lakh)
1.5P 6MT12.97
1.5P CVT14.37
1.5D 6MT14.56
1.5D 6AT15.96

Hyundai Creta SX Premium variant

The Creta’s new SX Premium variant comes equipped with a Bose 8-speaker sound system, ventilated front seats, an 8-way power-adjustable driver’s seat, leather upholstery for all seats, and scooped-out seatbacks for extra second-row legroom. Starting at Rs 16.18 lakh, the SX Premium variant can be had with either the 6-speed manual or CVT for the Creta’s 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol unit, but only the manual option for the 1.5-litre turbo-diesel engine.

Hyundai Creta SX Premium price breakdown (ex-showroom)
VariantPrice (Rs, lakh)
1.5P 6MT16.18
1.5P CVT17.68
1.5D 6MT17.76

Hyundai Creta SX(O) price and features increased

Only SX(O) diesel automatic exempt from price hike

Most of the Creta’s SX(O) variants have undergone a price increase of Rs 8,000 as part of the 2025 model refresh, and it now starts at Rs 17.46 lakh. Curiously, Hyundai hasn’t hiked prices for the SX(O) diesel automatic trim, which still costs Rs 19.99 lakh.

Hyundai Creta SX(O) price breakdown (ex-showroom)
VariantPrice (Rs, lakh)
1.5P 6MT17.46
1.5P CVT18.92
1.5D 6MT19.04
1.5D 6AT19.99
1.5 Turbo 7DCT20.18

New features and colour options for Creta buyers

Hyundai will now offer a smart key with motion sensor starting from the S(O) variants, and the SX(O) trims will come with a rain sensor, rear wireless charger and scooped seatbacks. Buyers can also choose two new colour options – Titan Grey Matte and Starry Night – on all Creta variants.
